content:
When introducing the Cafe24 corporate site to internal employees, the following components should be included:

1. Overview: A clear and concise overview of the purpose and goals of the corporate site, including information on how it will benefit the company and its employees.
2. User experience: A demonstration of the site's user experience, including its navigation, design, and functionality.
3. Content: An explanation of the types of content that will be included on the site, such as company news, product information, and employee resources.
4. Branding: An overview of the company's brand guidelines and how they will be reflected on the site.
5. Accessibility: Information on how employees can access the site, including login procedures and access privileges.
6. Maintenance: Details on how the site will be maintained and updated, including who will be responsible for managing content and updates.
7. Training: A training session to help employees understand how to use the site effectively and contribute to its success.
8. Feedback: An opportunity for employees to provide feedback and suggestions on the site, which can be used to improve its design and functionality.
9. Ongoing support: Availability of ongoing support and resources to help employees understand and effectively use the site.
